title: Jiang Ying (musician)
text:
Jiang Ying (; August 11, 1919 – February 5, 2012) was a Chinese <a href="opera">opera</a> singer and music teacher. She was the wife of Chinese <a href="rocket%20scientist">rocket scientist</a> <a href="Qian%20Xuesen">Qian Xuesen</a>, to whom she was married from 1947 until 2009 (his death)
Early life.
On 11 Aug 1919, Jiang was born in <a href="Haining%2C%20Zhejiang">Haining, Zhejiang</a>, <a href="China">China</a>. Jiang was of mixed <a href="Han%20Chinese">Chinese</a> and <a href="Japanese%20people">Japanese</a> descent. She was the third daughter of <a href="Jiang%20Baili">Jiang Baili</a>, a leading military strategist of <a href="Chiang%20Kai-shek">Chiang Kai-shek</a>, and his Japanese wife, . She was a distant relative of the <a href="wuxia">wuxia</a> novelist <a href="Jin%20Yong">Louis Cha</a>.
Education.
In 1936 Jiang went to Europe with her father and studied music in <a href="Berlin">Berlin</a>. Jiang graduated from Universität der Künste Berlin in 1941. When <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> broke out in Europe, Jiang had to move and further studied opera in Switzerland. Jiang graduated from <a href="Musikhochschule%20Luzern">Musikhochschule Luzern</a> in 1944.
Career.
Jiang went back to China (at that time the <a href="Republic%20of%20China%20%281912%E2%80%9349%29">Republic of China</a>). On 31 May 1947, as a Chinese opera singer, Jiang first performed in <a href="Shanghai">Shanghai</a>.
In 1947, Jiang moved to the United States. In 1955, when her husband Qian was deported by the United States government, Jiang went to the <a href="People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">People's Republic of China</a> together with him. Qian and Jiang entered China through <a href="Kowloon">Kowloon</a>, <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a>.
Jiang became a professor of music and opera, and head of the department of Western Vocal Music at the <a href="Central%20Conservatory%20of%20Music">Central Conservatory of Music</a> in <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a>.
Personal.
In 1947 in <a href="Shanghai">Shanghai</a>, Jiang married <a href="Qian%20Xuesen">Qian Xuesen</a> (aka <a href="Hsue-Shen%20Tsien">Hsue-Shen Tsien</a>). He was a <a href="rocket%20scientist">rocket scientist</a> and engineer who co-founded the <a href="Jet%20Propulsion%20Laboratory">Jet Propulsion Laboratory</a> at the <a href="California%20Institute%20of%20Technology">California Institute of Technology</a> and later led the <a href="Outer%20space">space</a> program of the <a href="People%27s%20Republic%20of%20China">People's Republic of China</a>.
Jiang died on 5 February 2012 in <a href="Beijing">Beijing</a>, <a href="China">China</a>.
